instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Good morning, this Mac intermittently switches on, and often does not. The restoration of the T2 was done, but it didn't have any effect.  There are no signs of oxidation.

Voltage:
 PPbus 12.62V;
<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 0.8V;
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN_R</SIGNAL> 0V.
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL> 0V, pulseless.
<SIGNAL>UPC_PMU_RESET</SIGNAL> 0V, 90mV;
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.36V

diode:
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN</SIGNAL> 0.630
<SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_IN_R</SIGNAL> 0.598
<SIGNAL>UPC_PMU_RESET</SIGNAL> 0.698

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 0.8V"
Disconnect Touch ID and check again.
There should be 3V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: I've already tested with the peripherals disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R8015</RESISTOR> ohm value.
Also post diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
Remove <RESISTOR>R4911</RESISTOR> and check again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8015</RESISTOR> 9.89K Ohm.
<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 0,693V
After removing R491 the <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> became 3.3V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: Resolder <RESISTOR>R4911</RESISTOR>, remove <CAPACITOR>C4955</CAPACITOR> and check <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.38V.
The machine does not show an image, but the processor heats up as if working and the trackpad works with the click.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: Did you test for USB activity and external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: No USB activity and no video on the outside, even with the display disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: Reconnect Touch ID and check if <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is good now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
The mac turns the cooler and stops. The external SSD turns the light on and off.

<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
"this Mac intermittently switches on, and often does not"
Did you mean it was working sometime?
Or just turned on, but no activity?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
In the start the Mac turn on then we clean <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> because has dirt.
Now the Mac don't turn on.
We already test the peripherals and all are working fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Please clarify, do not confuse turn on with working state.
Did you get image before cleaning it?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 71407, member: 682"]
Did you get image before cleaning it?
[/QUOTE]
Yes, I informed this at the beginning of the post, we activated the Mac after doing the t2, I tested all functions and did not identify any defect. When the machine is turned off and when I try to turn it on again it doesn't turn on, the external SSD light turns on without blinking, it doesn't give any image on the external or on the display. I notice that the Fan accelerates and turns off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: What is the voltage on USB-C input now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: I don't have the USB-C Amp Meter device yet.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: But you can still measure voltage at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 20.42V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Something happened in the cleaning process.
Check for knocked off components first.
Reball/change <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: I would like to know what voltages I can measure to identify the defective <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: Usually LDO rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: The machine turns on only if you press the power button for 5 seconds.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
And starts with full speed fan?
Possibly error with some SMC sensor.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Yes, the fan spins for 2 seconds and stops.
How can I identify which sensor is causing this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
I didn't understand you; the machine only stays on 2s in SMC bypass?
I was thinking it works then...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: If you hold the button for 5 seconds it turns on. But if you just one click on the button it turns the fan and stops.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Just turns on, or machine boots to OSX?
If yes, check SMC sensors level, pages 52-55.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> 1.12V ~ 0V, oscillating
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 91mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_HS_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 13mV
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PP3V3_WLANBT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_CALPE_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_PP1V8_WLANBT_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.62V down to 12.31V, oscillates every 15sec.

threads.message:

Just turns on, or machine boots to OSX?

machine boots to OSX.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: And you get such oscillations when logged into OSX?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: I don't know, I tested it with the board out of the topcase.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
If you get USB activity, board boots.
You can also connect external monitor (not really needed).
Good enough to know that and check if signals are steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: It is not possible to test. The device keeps switching on and off, the external SSD light doesn't flash and keeps switching on and off. <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is 1.12V when the light is on and when it is off it drops to 0V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: But yo've said machine boots in SMC bypass mode; what happened?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
If I press power the machine turns on, but no image. 
If I hold down power for 5 seconds it turns on, but it's not SMC bypass mode, because it doesn't stay on with the fan running. 
          Testing the board with only the external SSD and the charger, the external SSD light doesn't blink. 
        Tomorrow I will try to initialize the device by pressing <SIGNAL>PM_ONOFF</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: Did you understand?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Pressing power button 5s turns on the board, but doesn't boot?
Do not confuse on board with working board.

Do you get CPU voltages at least?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Man, this Mac is very intermittent. I made a video of its behavior. Most of the time it doesn't turn on even when pressing power. At the end of the video, the device accelerates the fan.

L7430 0V
L7420 0V
L7410 0V
L7210 0.65V
L7220 0.75V
L7270 0.8V


[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/14eRcHrFOxBiI8XYUSUO6l3gE_LovySy9/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message:
Try again DFU mode.
If no important data, choose restore option; it will erase SSD!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not powering up
threads.message: We have already performed this procedure, but we will try again.
